result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court will allow transfer to Rock County.
Court will allow early for termination of probation after one (1) year and with Agent's approval.
Apply 18 days of sentence credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 3.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to Court costs ($243) and DNA surcharge ($250).  PAID IN FULL.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
No use or possession of a firearm.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Continue with all treatment and medications deemed appropriate.
No contact with prior employer and the victims listed in the criminal complaint except with their permission and Agent's approval.
Defendant is to write a letters of apology to the victim and prior employer.  To be facililated by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 145 days sentence credit.
Court will allow the balance to be served in Rock County.
Concurrent with: Count 3.
